database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all of the MYSQL statements that is used for the whole program, from login to gameplay. All methods conatining any SQL lines use the Cleaner class for cleanup at the end of it's execution. Most if, not all statements uses preparedStatement.
    See Also:
    Config, ConnectionPool, Cleaner

    • Method Detail

      • importUnitType

        public ProtoUnitType importUnitType(int unitIdInput)
        Imports the values for a unit type and returns them as a ProtoUnitType
        Parameters:
        unitIdInput - int to identify which unit type to import
        Returns:
        ProtoUnitType
        See Also:
        ProtoUnitType

      • findGamesAvailable

        public java.util.ArrayList<Match> findGamesAvailable()
        A select statement that puts all created matches that has not been started yet in a list. Checks if the match is password protected or not, and updates the value in that specified match accordingly.
        Returns:
        ArrayList a list of current matches that has been created, but not started. Arraylist contains Match objects.
        See Also:
        Match

      • quickMatch_search

        public int quickMatch_search(int player_id)
        Searches through all the games that has been created and not started that is NOT password protected. Joins the first one available.
        Parameters:
        player_id - id of the player that is searching for games.
        Returns:
        int, -1 on error, returns match_id on success.
        See Also:
        MainMenuController

      • joinGame

        public void joinGame(int match_id,
                     int player2)
        A method to join selected match, using match_id to identify match.
        Parameters:
        match_id - match id of the match that is being joined.
        player2 - player id of the user joining the game.
        See Also:
        MainMenuController, MatchSetupController

      • createGame

        public int createGame(int player_id,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Creates a game. If no password is given as a parameter, it will default to null and be an open game which everyone can join.
        Parameters:
        player_id - player id of the player creating the game
        password - if game is password protected, use a string. If not, it will default to null.
        Returns:
        int, returns match_id on success, -1 on failure
        See Also:
        MainMenuController, MatchSetupController

      • pollGameStarted

        public boolean pollGameStarted(int match_id)
        Polls once whether the game has started or not. Used when a game has been created to check if another player has joined your game.
        Parameters:
        match_id - id of the match being polled.
        Returns:
        boolean, returns true when an opponent has been found, false if not.
        See Also:
        MainMenuController, MatchSetupController

      • abortMatch

        public void abortMatch(int player_id)
        Deletes game(s) that has been created by the player_id given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        player_id - id of the player's match that'll be deleted

      • fetchUnitTypeList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fetchUnitTypeList()
        Imports a list of UnitTypeIds. This is used to identify which Units to import.
        Returns:
        ArrayList. Returns an integer ArrayList of the different UnitTypeIds
        See Also:
        GameMain, GameLogic

      • getPlayers

        public void getPlayers()
        Updates the variable class with your opponents player_id
        See Also:

      • exportPlacementUnits

        public void exportPlacementUnits(java.util.ArrayList<Unit> exportUnitList,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> exportPositionXList,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> exportPositionYList)
        Used at the end of the placement phase, this method is used to export the placed units and their position to the database.
        Parameters:
        exportUnitList - ArrayList. A list of Units
        exportPositionXList - ArrayList. Position x for the exported units
        exportPositionYList - ArrayList. Position Y for the exported units
        See Also:
        Unit, placementPhaseFinished

      • importPlacementUnits

        public java.util.ArrayList<PiecePlacer> importPlacementUnits()
        Imports the result of the opponents players placement phase. The values are imported as a List of PiecePlacer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList. List of PiecePlacer, contains Unit values and position X, Y.
        See Also:
        PiecePlacer

      • checkIfOpponentReady

        public boolean checkIfOpponentReady()
        Checks if your opponent is ready during the placement phase of the game.
        Returns:
        Boolean. True if opponent is ready, false if not.

        See Also:

      • obstaclesHaveBeenAdded

        public java.lang.Boolean obstaclesHaveBeenAdded()
        Checks if the correct amount of obstacles have been added in accordance with the # of obstacles in the database in a given match
        Returns:
        Boolean. True if local obstacles and server obstacles are equal. False if not.
        See Also:
        GameMain, GameLogic

      • sendTurn

        public void sendTurn(int turn)
        Updates the database with a new turn. Handles exception case with round 1.
        Parameters:
        turn - turn number.
        See Also:
        GameMain

      • login

        public int login(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
        Takes given username and password to log in.
        Parameters:
        username - username to account
        password - password to account
        Returns:
        int, user id if login is successful, -1 if not.
        See Also:
        LoginController

      • logout

        public boolean logout(int userId)
        Logs out a user.
        Parameters:
        userId - user id of user to log out of.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • signUp

        public int signUp(java.lang.String user,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String email)
        Creates a new user using user name, password and e-mail. Password gets a hash using SALT and then stored on the database.
        Parameters:
        user - new account user name.
        password - new account password.
        email - new account email.
        Returns:
        int, 1 for registration success, 0 if account exists, -1 if error.

      • generateHash

        private byte[] generateHash(java.lang.String password,
                            byte[] salt)
        Generates a hash. Uses PBDKF2 method from SecretKeyFactory
        Parameters:
        password - entered password that will be hashed.
        salt - the salt used as input in the hashing.
        Returns:
        hash in byte[]
        See Also:
        SecretKeyFactory, KeySpec

      • verifyPassword

        private boolean verifyPassword(java.lang.String password,
                               byte[] hash,
                               byte[] salt)
        Compares the given password with the one stored on the database .
        Parameters:
        password - given password.
        hash - hash from database.
        salt - users' SALT.
        Returns:
        boolean, returns true if password matches, false if not

      • addUserToDatabase

        private void addUserToDatabase(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String email,
                               byte[] hash,
                               byte[] salt)
        Adds user to database.
        Parameters:
        username - new users' username.
        email - new users' email.
        hash - new users' hashed password.
        salt - new users' SALT.
        See Also:
        Database
